appearance: Molding is incompletely filled by injection.
cause:
1.Melt temperature, mold surface temperature and injection speed are too low.
2.Incompletety plasticized plastic melt.
3.The injection pressure is insufficient.
4.Screw diameter is too big.
5.Inadequate mold venting.
6.Inadequate flowability of the plastic melt.
7.The mold was designed with wall thicknesses which are too small or with long, thin-walled ribs or long flow paths.
8.Unfavorable nozzle bore and sprue geometry.
correction:
1.Increase the melt and/or mold surface temperatures together with the injection speed.
2.Increase the shot volume and check the nonreturn valve. (Shot volume too low; no melt cushion).
3.Increase back pressure.
4.Match the injection unit to fit both pressure and melt volume requirements.
5.Improve mold venting/reduce clamping force.
6.Switch to an easy flowing material grade.
7.Modify the mold to suit the material.
8.Enlarge the nozzle bore, runner and sprue cross section.

picture.caption: Fig. 13.1: Crosspiece incompletely formed; scanning electron micrograph, magnification 7:1
Fig. 13.2: Detail from Fig. 13.1; scanning electron micrograph, magnification 50:1
